msContents.summary: Apollonides writes to Zenon again about mattresses and money to be paid to Kriton (cf. P.Col. III 15); he mentions that Rhodon is carrying letters for Apollonios about wages to be paid to someone

msItem.note: The hand is similar but not identical with that of P.Col. III 15, another letter from Apollonides
Written across the fibers with 5 lines; on the back, along the fibers, address and docket
Plate in P.Col. III facing p. 62

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Dr. Kondilios through H.I. Bell in July 1925; no. 94 in Bell

div.ab: Apollonides to Zenon, greeting. Please (pay back to Kriton?) his ex- penditure upon the fifty-mina mattresses if you have received them from him and if they are very good for you. (I have given?) to Apollonios the letter which Kriton brought. And now (please forward) to him the letters which Rhodon is bringing in order that (I may pay the workmen?) their wages complete.
